com.uttt.common

Interface TestExceptionValidator


  • public interface TestExceptionValidator
    A JUnit test augmenter that validates an expected exception (ala @Test(expected=ExType.class)), but also verifies the exception's message detail. Mostly, this foofalah is needed because of the iteraction with standard JUnit stack filtering and using junit.Assert.* methods in a test that has an expected exception by way of the @Test(expected=...) annotation.

    How to use: 

      @Test
 public void descriptiveMethodName() {
     TestExceptionValidator.validate(Exception.class,
         "Abc[=123]: lorem ipsum",
         new TestExceptionValidator.Trigger() {
              @Override
             public void action() {
                 // simple code triggering expected exception & message, above
             }
         }
     );
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TestExceptionValidator.Trigger
      Client code will annonymously extend the Trigger class and define it's single abstract method, action().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void validate(java.lang.Class<?> type, java.lang.String expectedMsg, TestExceptionValidator.Trigger trigger)
      Will run trigger.action() within a try - catch (Throwable) construct and then validate that an exception was indeed caught, of the right type, and that it's message is as expected.

        Will run trigger.action() within a try - catch (Throwable) construct and then validate that an exception was indeed caught, of the right type, and that it's message is as expected.
